snippet: The statistics present a different picture of President Obama’s policies from the one painted by many immigrant advocates, who have called him the “deporter in chief.”
abstract: Justice Department statistics say new deportation cases brought by Obama administration in nation's immigration courts have declined steadily since 2009; states' deportations through courts have fallen 43 percent, as judges have increasingly ruled against them; statistics present different picture of Pres Obama’s enforcement policies from one painted by many immigrant advocates.
lead_paragraph: The statistics present a different picture of President Obama’s policies from the one painted by many immigrant advocates, who have called him the “deporter in chief.”

headline.main: Court Deportations Drop 43 Percent in Past Five Years
headline.print_headline: Deportations by Courts Drop 43% in 5 Years
